info.p: Finite-state transducers are finite-state automata that map between two sets of symbols. They are commonly used in lexical analysis. The XFST and HFST projects ("X" for Xerox, "H" for Helsinki) use a plain-text format defined by Beesley and Karttunen. See the following for more details:

li.a: Kenneth R. Beesley and Lauri Karttunen, Finite-State Morphology, 2003. Series: CSLI Studies in Computational Linguistics; University of Chicago Press.

ul.li: HfstXfst wiki, part of the Helsinki Finite-State Technology project
